result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustavo Valdez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality-"Repeater"], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: current sentence & consecutive to count 3

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Once released must reside in a halfway house. Undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with the recommendations.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: current sentence & consecutive to count 3

Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: current sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

**AMENDED 9/27/2017:  FINE & CC REDUCED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.  DEFENDANT TO PAY FINE AND CC WHILE ON ES**

**AMENDED 7/31/2020:  DOC is limited to an assignment of 25% of earnings, assets and other goods towards the unpaid balance of his monetary obligations.**
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Once released must reside in a halfway house. Undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with the recommendations.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Gustavo Valdez in court, in custody.  Defendant appears pro se. Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The defendant has filed a post conviction motion and a motion to continue the hearing.  The defendant chooses to testify on his own behalf. GV - DSAT. Direct statement to the Court. Defendant marks Ex #1. Cross xam by the State. State marks Ex #2. Defense calls Atty Melissa Frost - DSAT. Direct by defense. Cross xam by the State. State moves Ex #2 into evidence/received. Parties give argument. 

BTC: Motion to continue the matter is moot and is therefore, denied. Defense motion for post conviction relief is denied. Fine is reduced to $2,000.00 + cc and is to be paid on ES. If defendant cannot pay by then, the costs will be reduced to civil judgment. Civil judgment ruling is reversed.
To postpone hearing scheduled for spetember 25, 2017.  Filed Pro Se

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
